column4: hi there. i've installed openoffice.org 3 using this PPA: https://launchpad.net/~openoffice-pkgs/+archive
somewhere in my updates this got removed
now i checked that i have the correct entries in my sources.list but I'm unable to install openoffice
i can't even go to the preivous oofice
see the link you just posted ;)
try installing it again, then copypaste the entire output you get to pastebin
ok. gimme a sec
also, make sure the ppa stuff is gone from sources.list and you did apt-get update before that.
http://pastebin.com/m6c50ff2f and yeah i removed those entries from the file and updated everything
hmm. Is the output of sudo aptitude install openoffice.org more verbose?
nop mate, just what i shown you.

okay. Open Synaptic (System > Administration > Synaptic), click the "Status" button in the bottom-left, then click the "Installed (local or obsolete)" section. Anything related to openoffice.org in there?
checking
yeah, openoffice 3.0
remove anything in there related to OO.org, then try installing again (you'll get 2.4). When the PPA comes back up, you could consider adding the PPA again and upgrading if you need 3.0.
the thing is that i've been using oo3.0 in windows and mac. all my current docs are under that format. i'm afraid i can lose my stuff :( anyway tks a lot for the help mate
I would've thought that oo3.0 was backwards compatible with 2.4. That isn't the case?
afaik no. and there is no msoffice2007 oxml support
anyway, thanks dude
you're welcome. Hopefully 3.0 will be back in the PPA soon...
let's hope so. i guess i'll wait and edit everything in my mac from the time being. once again thank you very much
